content: The Berber flag has an upper band of blue like the Mediterranean Sea, then a green band like the plains of Tamazgha, and finally a yellow band representing the desert. Upon these stripes is superimposed the letter Aza (yaz) âµ¥, symbolizing the tifinagh, ancient writing of Imazighen, in red, representing blood and freedom.
translations: ita:La bandiera berbera ha una fascia superiore blu come il Mar Mediterraneo, poi una fascia verde come le pianure di Tamazg
